law.catch_line: The State Board shall reinstate the State license of a master electrician who is not on inactive sta...

text.section:
The State Board shall reinstate the State license of a master electrician who is not on inactive status and who has failed to renew the State license for any reason, if the master electrician:
applies to the State Board for reinstatement within 2 years after the State license expires;
meets the renewal requirements of § 6-310 of this subtitle; and
in addition to the renewal fee required under § 6-310 of this subtitle, pays to the State Board a reinstatement fee of:
$25 for up to and including a 30-day late renewal;
$50 for up to and including a 60-day late renewal; or
$100 for a late renewal over 60 days.

If a master electrician who has failed to renew the State license for any reason applies for reinstatement more than 2 years after the State license has expired, the State Board shall require the master electrician to pay a reinstatement fee of $100, and comply with the requirements for obtaining a State license under §§ 6-304, 6-307, and 6-503 of this title.
